title: Remove landing page pricing and add dashboard Subscriptions page

requirements.summary: Remove the existing 3-tier pricing table section from the landing page
acceptanceCriteria: The pricing section is completely removed from LandingPage.tsx
The landing page layout remains clean and cohesive after removal
All references to the pricing tiers in the landing page are eliminated

file_operations.description: Remove the pricing section that displays the 3-tier pricing table (Professional Free, Enterprise $49/mo, Sovereign $149/mo). Delete the entire pricing container div and all related JSX elements including tier cards, pricing details, and feature lists. Preserve all other sections of the landing page including hero, features, testimonials, and footer.

requirements.summary: Create a new Subscriptions page accessible from the dashboard sidebar after Analytics & Vault
acceptanceCriteria: New route created for /subscriptions page
Subscriptions link appears in DashboardLayout sidebar after Analytics & Vault
Page is accessible to all authenticated users
Navigation follows the existing sidebar patterns with icons and labels

file_operations.description: Create a new Subscriptions page component that will display subscription pricing tiers. Include a page header with title 'Subscriptions' and subtitle explaining the subscription options. Set up the basic page structure using the same glassmorphism styling patterns found in other dashboard pages with midnight black backgrounds and grid layouts for tier cards.

Register the /subscriptions route in the router configuration. Add the route definition after the analytics-vault route and before the sentinel-protocol route. Import the Subscriptions component and wrap it with ProtectedRoute to ensure only authenticated users can access it.

Add a 'Subscriptions' navigation link in the sidebar menu items array after the 'Analytics & Vault' link. Use an appropriate icon from lucide-react (e.g., CreditCard or DollarSign) and set the href to '/subscriptions'. Follow the existing navigation item pattern with icon, label, and active state styling.

requirements.summary: Implement two subscription pricing tiers with glassmorphism card styling on the Subscriptions page
acceptanceCriteria: Two pricing cards displayed side-by-side in a responsive grid layout
Each card shows tier name, monthly price in Indian Rupees (₹), and feature list
Cards use glassmorphism effects matching the existing bento grid cards
Hover effects and BorderBeam animations are applied for premium feel

file_operations.description: Add a responsive grid layout (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2) containing two pricing tier cards. Each card should use the same glassmorphism styling as BentoCard components with backdrop-blur, border gradients, and hover effects. Include BorderBeam component on card hover for the premium animated border effect. Structure each card with: tier name heading, large price display showing '₹300' or '₹500' with '/month' suffix, feature list section (to be populated in REQ-94), and a CTA button placeholder (to be implemented in REQ-95). Apply consistent spacing, padding, and the midnight black background theme.

requirements.summary: Differentiate features between Basic (₹300/month) and Premium (₹500/month) tiers based on importance
acceptanceCriteria: Basic tier (₹300/month) includes: Neural Frequency Visualizer, Sentiment Analysis, Meeting ROI Tracking, Speaker Identity Matrix, Voice Pattern Recognition, up to 10 meeting recordings per month

Premium tier (₹500/month) includes: All Basic features plus Sentinel Protocol access, Panic Mode, Environment Spoofing, Packet Jitter Simulator, Dark Web Monitoring, Threat Detection Matrix, Executive Briefing Generator, unlimited meeting recordings, priority support
Each feature is clearly listed under its respective tier
Visual indicators (checkmarks/icons) show which features are included in each tier
Feature descriptions are concise and emphasize value/benefits

file_operations.description: Populate the feature lists for both pricing tiers. For the Basic tier card, add a features array containing: Neural Frequency Visualizer, Sentiment Analysis, Meeting ROI Tracking, Speaker Identity Matrix, Voice Pattern Recognition, and 'Up to 10 meeting recordings/month'. For the Premium tier card, add a features array with all Basic features plus: Sentinel Protocol access, Panic Mode, Environment Spoofing, Packet Jitter Simulator, Dark Web Monitoring, Threat Detection Matrix, Executive Briefing Generator, 'Unlimited meeting recordings', and 'Priority support'. Render each feature as a list item with a checkmark icon from lucide-react (Check or CheckCircle2) in cyber emerald color. Use proper spacing and typography to make features scannable and emphasize value.

requirements.summary: Add Subscribe CTA buttons with simulated subscription flow toast notifications
acceptanceCriteria: Each tier card has a prominent CTA button with Cyber Emerald glow effect matching landing page buttons
Button text reads 'Subscribe to Basic' or 'Subscribe to Premium' respectively
Clicking the button triggers a Sonner toast notification explaining this is a simulated subscription interface
Buttons are styled consistently with existing PrimaryCTA components

file_operations.description: Add Subscribe buttons to both pricing tier cards using the PrimaryCTA component for consistent styling with cyber emerald glow effects. Set button text to 'Subscribe to Basic' for the ₹300/month tier and 'Subscribe to Premium' for the ₹500/month tier. Implement onClick handlers that trigger Sonner toast notifications with a message like 'Subscription flow is currently simulated. Stripe integration coming soon!' Use toast.info() from sonner with appropriate styling. Position buttons at the bottom of each card with proper margin and full-width styling on mobile.
